business.headline: From watches to antiques, these luxury goods above Rs 10 lakh face 1% TCSThe Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) has issued fresh guidelines to enforce the levy, which aims to plug tax leaks and boost visibility on big-ticket purchases.

'Operation Zeppelin' reveals details of Adani's counter to Hindenburg: ReportIn January 2023, Hindenburg published a scathing report against the Adani Group. The counter to its damning report against the conglomerate was dubbed 'Operation Zeppelin'.

European Union fines Apple $570 million, Meta $228 million under new tech lawsThe fines levied on the two American tech giants are likely to stoke tensions with US President Donald Trump, who has threatened to levy tariffs against countries that penalise US companies.

Looking for high FD rates? These banks offer interest of over 9%A few small finance banks are offering attractive interest rates, some as high as 9.10% for senior citizens. These banks are using competitive rates to draw in long-term deposits, making them a smart pick for cautious investors.
Sensex closes 520 points higher; Nifty above 24,300; HCLTech jumps 8%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 520.90 points to close at 80,116.49, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 161.50 points to end at 24,328.95.

Crude oil prices fall below $70, will you get fuel price relief soon?The last reduction in petrol and diesel prices was in March 2024, when prices were cut by Rs 2, just ahead of the general elections. Before that, prices remained unchanged for almost two years.

Ather Energy IPO: 5 key things to know before investingAther Energy's IPO will open for public subscription on Monday, April 28, 2025 and will close on April, 30, 2025, while anchor investors will get their allotment on April, 25.
Elon Musk says he'll spend 'less time at DOGE' as Tesla profits fall 71%DOGE, a government body aimed at cutting public spending, has been a major focus for Musk over the past several months.

Forgot to declare your tax regime choice to employer? Here's what happensIf the old regime is better for you, and you have invested heavily under Section 80C, but don't inform your employer, more tax might be deducted from your salary during the year.

'100% tariffs create anxiety': Tesla says still weighing when to enter IndiaTesla has lobbied India for years to cut its sky-high duties, with Elon Musk calling them among the steepest in the world. Despite no breakthrough yet, Tesla has recently leased showroom space and listed over two dozen job openings in India.

LG Electronics delays IPO amid market uncertainty: ReportThe South Korean company has told its advisers that it might postpone the IPO of its Indian unit. The reported pause in plans comes at a time when Dalal Street is seeing ups and downs.

BluSmart hires Grant Thornton for forensic audit after Sebi probe: ReportBluSmart, which operates over 8,000 EV taxis and has a strong presence in cities like Delhi, Mumbai, and Bengaluru, had to suspend services last week.

RBI issues a new directive for banks to curb digital fraud. Details hereTo fight online fraud, the RBI had earlier announced the plan to introduce exclusive domains for banks and financial institutions. Now, that plan is taking shape.

Gold price falls from all-time high. Check latest prices in IndiaGold prices had been rising earlier due to a weaker US dollar and ongoing trade tension between the United States and China. However, the sentiment changed after a more positive message from the US President.

Income Tax 2025: Check step-by-step process to pay tax in minutesWhether you're a salaried individual, a business owner, or a freelancer, this digital facility helps with paying your taxes right from the comfort of your home, without the need to stand in long queues or fill out tedious forms.

Ather Energy IPO: Check opening date, price band and other key detailsAther Energy IPO: The subscription window will open on Monday, April 28, and close on Wednesday, April 30. Ahead of this, allocation to anchor investors is scheduled for Friday, April 25.

HCLTech shares jumps nearly 7% after Q4 results. Should you buy, hold or sell?The IT major reported a net profit of Rs 4,307 crore for Q4FY25, marking an 8% year-on-year increase. Revenue from operations rose 6% YoY to Rs 30,246 crore. Read to know if you should buy, sell, or hold the stock.

Gold at $4,000 by next year? Here's what JP Morgan saysJP Morgan sees gold averaging $3,675 per ounce by the fourth quarter of 2025 and noted that prices could reach the $4,000 mark sooner if investor and central bank demand remains strong.

Sensex crosses 80,000 level: 3 reasons behind Dalal Street's rallySensex added over 500 points and crossed the 80,000 mark once again, after having corrected nearly 12-15% earlier this year. Sensex had crossed the 80,000 level for the first time in early July 2024.

HCLTech, Tech Mahindra, Infosys, TCS: Why are IT stocks rising today?IT stocks stole the spotlight on Wednesday, rallying sharply on global cues, Trump's China remarks, and renewed FII interest. Will the momentum continue? Here is all you need to know.
Explained: Why HCLTech share price gained 7% in early tradeHCLTech shares were up 6.07% to Rs 1,569.95 at around 9:19 am.
Sensex, Nifty extend gains on positive global cues; HCL Tech surges over 7%The S&P BSE Sensex added 572.48 points to 80,168.07, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 165.90 points to 24,333.15 as of 9:18 am.

Adani exits telecom play, transfers entire spectrum to AirtelThe development comes at a time when Adani Data Network was at risk of losing its entire 400 megahertz (MHz) spectrum in the 26 Gigahertz (GHz) band for not meeting its roll-out obligations.
Sensex, Nifty opening: Stock markets to open higher. Here's whyStock market indices closed in the green for the sixth day in a row, and Nifty hit a new calendar year high of 24,242 on Tuesday.

Stocks to watch on April 23: HLCTech, Airtel, LTIMindtree, Bajaj Housing FinanceSeveral stocks such as HCLTech, Airtel, Waaree Energies, Varun Beverages, tec are likely to remain in focus today due to earnings updates, business announcements, and market activity.

IMF cuts global growth forecast, cites 'significant slowdown' due to Trump tariffsThe IMF reduced its global growth forecast to 2.8% for 2025, down by 0.5 percentage point, while the 2024 forecast was cut by 0.3 points to 3%, down from the January projection of 3.3% for both years.

Tankup Engineers IPO: Check price, dates, GMP and should you subscribe?Tankup Engineers, known for building specialised vehicle superstructures, aims to raise Rs 19.53 crore through a fresh issue of 13.95 lakh shares.

'Gold is money': Zoho's Sridhar Vembu backs yellow metal as prices cross Rs 1 lakhOn Monday, gold June futures on the MCX hit a new high of Rs 99,178 per 10 grams, up nearly Rs 1,900 from the previous close. In the physical market, gold traded at Rs 97,200 per 10 grams (excluding GST), taking the final retail price past Rs 1 lakh after adding 3% GST.
Sensex closes 187 points higher, Nifty above 24,100; IndusInd bank down 5%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 187.09 points to close at 79,595.59, while the NSE Nifty50 added 41.70 points to end at 24,167.25.

Gold prices jump to $3,500 amid Trump vs Powell dramaPrices of gold, traditionally seen as a safe-haven asset amid economic and geopolitical uncertainty, have risen by nearly a third so far this year.

Walmart-backed Flipkart to return to India ahead of much-awaited IPOFlipkart has grown into a large e-commerce platform that competes directly with Amazon in the market and is planning a public listing.
Gold prices are booming, but Dubai's iconic Gold Souk is losing its sparkleThere are signs of change amid rising prices for gold, as buyers look to diamonds and lighter gold jewellery, instead.

Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme ends on April 30. Resolve your income tax disputes nowThe Vivad Se Vishwas Scheme is all about reducing pending tax cases and giving taxpayers a chance to settle things amicably.

East or West, gold is the bestThe sharp rise in gold prices comes at a time when global markets are under pressure due to the falling US dollar and rising uncertainty in the US economy, especially after recent statements by Donald Trump.

China's gold ATM melts jewellery and sends money in 30 minutes. Check here The gold ATM, which is set up in China's Shanghai, melts gold, checks its purity and weight, and transfers the value to your bank account.

Amazon, Walmart's Flipkart may gain from US push in India trade deal: ReportIndia currently imposes restrictions on foreign-owned online retailers, including bans on holding inventory and selling directly to consumers. Domestic players like Reliance, by contrast, face no such constraints, giving them an edge in both online and offline retail.

Air India eyes Boeing jets rejected by China amid trade tensions: ReportThe Tata Group-owned carrier, which is undergoing a fleet overhaul and rapid expansion, is in talks with Boeing Co. to acquire several planes that were being readied for Chinese carriers before fresh tariffs disrupted their delivery.

Is the Rs 500 note in your wallet real or fake? Look out for this small typoThe Ministry of Home Affairs has flagged a surge in fake Rs 500 notes that are so well-made, even experienced handlers are finding it hard to detect them.

Gensol Engineering may face ED probe for money laundering chargesThe latest development comes at a time when Sebi uncovered a fraud at Gensol Engineering and questions are being raised about the company's financial practices.

Gold touches Rs 1 lakh: 5 things you must knowGold June futures on the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) hit a record Rs 99,178 per 10 grams on Monday. In the physical market, gold was priced at Rs 97,200 per 10 grams.

entertainment.headline: Will ensure Fawad Khan's Abir Gulaal isn't released in India: Film FederationIn response to the Pahalgam terror attack, FWICE has imposed a ban on Pakistani artistes, and is working to block the release of Abir Gulaal, a film featuring Fawad Khan in India.

CID to air a silent episode, Daya-Abhijeet call it a 'challenging experience'CID is set to air a special silent episode, offering viewers a unique experience as the investigative team faces a major challenge without dialogue.

Heads of State trailer: Priyanka, John Cena, Idris Alba get their guns blazingThe trailer of the action-packed comedy Heads of State, featuring Idris Elba, John Cena, and Priyanka Chopra Jonas, has been released ahead of its global premiere on Prime Video on July 2.

Tastefully Yours trailer: Netflix's next K-drama is classic enemies-to-lovers tale'Tastefully Yours', a highly anticipated K-drama starring Kang Ha-neul and Go Min-si, premieres on May 12, 2025. The romantic comedy promises culinary conflicts and a classic rivals-to-lovers plot.

Khauf review: A psychological horror where fear isn't just a feeling, it's a mirrorReleased-Fri Apr 18, 2025'Khauf' is a psychological horror series that delves into the unsettling fears rooted in patriarchy and trauma, rather than relying on typical jump scares. Set in Delhi, it follows Madhuri's haunting journey as she navigates past traumas and eerie experiences in a women's hostel, offering a raw portrayal of real-world horrors and emotional terror.

Sonakshi Sinha backs TV show Meri Bhavya Life, talks about body positivityBollywood actor Sonakshi Sinha has joined the promotion of the TV show 'Meri Bhavya Life,' which challenges societal norms regarding body image. In a recent promo, she is seen discussing her experiences with body-shaming and urged young girls to embrace body positivity.

Wednesday 2 teaser: Jenna Ortega is back to create more madness and mayhemNetflix released the much-awaited teaser of 'Wednesday' Season two on April 23. Along with the season's first glimpse, the release dates were also announced, splitting it into two parts.

Carlos Santana hospitalised before Texas concert due to medical emergencyLegendary musician Carlos Santana was hospitalised in Texas due to a medical emergency before his concert. The incident, suspected to be dehydration, led to the postponement of his San Antonio show. Santana's team remains hopeful for a swift recovery as he plans to continue his U.S. tour.

Director Tejas remembers shooting Emraan Hashmi's 'Ground Zero' in BaramullaDirector Tejas Vijay Deoskar, in an interview with India Today Digital, shared his experience of shooting 'Ground Zero' in Baramulla, Kashmir. The film, starring Emraan Hashmi in the lead, will release in theatres on April 25.

Alia Bhatt collaborates with her mimic Chandni for iconic ad and it is unmissableIt finally happened! Alia Bhatt collaborated with her mimic Chandni aka Alia Vatt for an iconic advertisement. Fans showered love on the video shared on Instagram.

Yami Gautam, Emraan Hashmi to star in film inspired by historic Shah Bano caseActors Yami Gautam and Emraan Hashmi to star in a film inspired by the historic Shah Bano case that is seen as one of the milestones in Muslim women's fight for rights.

Nani shares update on film with director Sujeeth: Delay due to Pawan Kalyan filmActor Nani cleared the air on his film with director Sujeeth. He revealed that the project is currently on pause as the director is working on Pawan Kalyan's 'OG'.

Kangana's Emergency faces legal row over alleged fact distortion by book's authorKangana Ranaut's film 'Emergency' is under legal scrutiny as journalist Coomi Kapoor accuses the filmmakers of distorting facts from her book. Kapoor claims breach of contract regarding adaptation rights and misuse of her name.

Lokesh Kanagaraj announces social media break until Coolie promotionsDirector Lokesh Kanagaraj has announced his break from social media, revealing he'll stay offline until promotions for his next film, 'Coolie', begin.

SRK, Salman Khan condemn Pahalgam attack: May we stand united as a nationShah Rukh Khan and Salman Khan condemned the recent terror attack in Pahalgam that claimed 26 lives, including two foreigners. The two actors voiced their anger in a post on X.

Cowards fighting outside the battlefield: Kangana Ranaut on Pahalgam attackActor and politician Kangana Ranaut shared a note on her Instagram stories, condemning the Pahalgam attack and expressing her rage over the incident. She called the attackers 'impotent'.

Not a tragedy we can move past: Priyanka Chopra mourns Pahalgam attack victimsPriyanka Chopra voiced her outrage over the recent terrorist attack in Pahalgam that claimed 26 lives, including two foreigners. She expressed her condolences to the grieving families and stated that the tragedy should shake human conscience.

15 years on, Dill Mill Gayye creator admits Armaan-Riddhima had toxic relationship'Dill Mill Gayye' creator Siddharth P Malhotra spoke to us in an exclusive interview about the show's mass appeal, the possibility of having part two, and the sorry state of Hindi television today.

Tamil actor-host Ramya Subramanian slams brand for AI-generated voiceover misuseTamil actor, host and health coach Ramya Subramanian slammed a wellness brand for misusing her video with an AI-generated voiceover. She warned them of legal action over the unauthorised content.

general news.headline: Indus Waters Treaty paused, no entry to Pakistanis: India responds to J&K attackIndia has unleashed a sweeping diplomatic offensive on Pakistan after the Pahalgam terror strike by suspending Indus Waters Treaty, sealing Wagah border and barring Pakistani nationals' entry into the country.

India's 5-pronged offensive against Pakistan after Pahalgam massacreIndia on Wednesday announced strong diplomatic measures against Pakistan, including the suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty and no entry for Pakistani nationals to India, following the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam, which claimed 26 lives.

India puts Indus Waters Treaty on hold: What it signifiesIndia has suspended the Indus Waters Treaty following the Pahalgam terror attack, halting the supply of 39 billion cubic meters of water annually from rivers such as the Indus, Jhelum, and Chenab originating from Jammu and Kashmir.

This is 56-inch chest: BJP's Nishikant Dubey after Indus Waters Treaty suspendedBJP MP Nishikant Dubey on Wednesday praised the government for putting the Indus Waters Treaty of 1960 on hold following the Pahalgam terror attack which killed 26 people.

Syed Adil Hussain: Hero Pahalgam pony ride operator who tried to stop terroristAt least 26 people were killed when terrorists opened fire on tourists in the popular Baisaran meadow in Pahalgam in one of the deadliest terrorist attacks in Kashmir in recent years.

What is Kalma, and what is its significance in IslamSome of the victims of the Pahalgam attack were asked to recite the Kalma or Kalima by the terrorists. What is Kalma, and what is its significance in Islam?

India suspends visa exemption for Pakistani nationals: What is the scheme?The SAARC Visa Exemption Scheme (SVES) has been suspended by India following the Pahalgam terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir.

'If attacked by India...': Ex-Pak minister's post day after Pahalgam attackAs India vowed retaliation for the deadly Pahalgam terror attack, former Pakistani Minister Chaudhry Fawad Hussain called for national unity, urging all political factions to stand together to defend the country.

Khauf review: A psychological horror where fear isn't just a feeling, it's a mirrorReleased-Fri Apr 18, 2025'Khauf' is a psychological horror series that delves into the unsettling fears rooted in patriarchy and trauma, rather than relying on typical jump scares. Set in Delhi, it follows Madhuri's haunting journey as she navigates past traumas and eerie experiences in a women's hostel, offering a raw portrayal of real-world horrors and emotional terror.

Muslims feeling weakened: Robert Vadra links Hindutva push to Pahalgam attackRobert Vadra said the government's Hindutva push makes minorities feel "uncomfortable and troubled". He called the Pahalgam attack 'a message to PM'.

Gunfight in Kulgam day after Pahalgam attack, TRF terrorist trappedA day after 26 people were killed in a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam, a gunfight broke out in Kulgam during which a top TRF commander was trapped.

From watches to antiques, these luxury goods above Rs 10 lakh face 1% TCSThe Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) has issued fresh guidelines to enforce the levy, which aims to plug tax leaks and boost visibility on big-ticket purchases.

US-based techie, IAF official among 26 killed in attack. Who were the victims?Authorities have released the names of the victims who lost their lives in the Pahalgam terror attack, acknowledging for the first time that 26 were killed in the massacre.

Don't let Pakistan win: Farooq Abdullah urges tourists to defy fear, visit Kashmir Amid rising security concerns in Jammu and Kashmir, National Conference president Farooq Abdullah on Wednesday appealed to tourists not to abandon their travel plans, asserting that their presence is a powerful message against fear and terrorism.

Mohammad Shami's 'All Eyes On Pahalgam' post to condemn terrorist attackFast bowler Mohammed Shami condemned the terror attack on tourists in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam in a strongly-worded post on social media. Virat Kohli and Sachin Tendulkar were among the several Indian sportspersons who condemned the terror attack.

To those behind the scenes in Pahalgam attack, we will get you: Rajnath SinghA day after 26 were killed in a targeted attack on tourists in Pahalgam, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh assured countrymen that those responsible for the heinous act will get a strong response in the near future.

Wildfire in New Jersey forces 3,000 to flee their homesA wildfire in New Jersey spread to 8,500 acres and forced 3,000 people to flee from their homes. A portion of the Garden State Parkway, one of the busiest highways, had to be closed, and power supply to 25,000 customers had to be cut. The US saw a devastating fire in Los Angeles earlier this year.
J&K attack: Rahul Gandhi cuts short US visit, to attend Congress' emergency meetRahul Gandhi, who was on a US visit, has cut short his trip to attend Congress Working Committee meeting on Thursday
Rough terrain, no security: Why attackers chose Pahalgam's BaisaranAt least 26 people died when terrorists opened fire at tourists relishing stunning scenes at Pahalgam's Baisaran.

Rohit Sharma, Trent Boult star as MI move to 3rd after SRH demolitionIPL 2025: Rohit Sharma's return to form and Mumbai Indians' rising momentum dealt another blow to SRH's struggling campaign. Their aggressive approach backfired again as another collapse ended up with MI handing them a 7-wicket defeat.

Pahalgam massacre is India's 'October 7', demands a bold and decisive responseWhat began as a sunny afternoon in Kashmir's Pahalgam turned into a bloodbath as at least 26 tourists were gunned down in a chilling, Pakistan-linked terror attack – an incident that echoed the horror of Israel's October 7 tragedy.

When 'mini Switzerland' Pahalgam bled: Videos show story of terrorPahalgam attack: The atrocity was captured in the many videos posted by survivors, revealing the chilling moments of one of the worst terror attacks on civilians in Jammu and Kashmir.

Should Indians rethink their study in the US dream?It's not entirely dismal on the US education scene for international students. There are ways to navigate the recent uncertainties due to policy shifts. And also people who could help.

Who's Pahalgam attack mastermind, who led the TRF strike? Explained in 5 pointsA group of terrorists opened fire on tourists in Pahalgam, Kashmir, on Tuesday, killing 26 people. While the group was reportedly led by Asif Fauji, Lashkar-e-Taiba's Saifullah Kasuri is believed to have planned the attack. The Resistance Front claimed responsibility for the attack. Here's all about Kasuri, Fauji and the TRF in five big points.

sports.headline: SRH to move away from all-attack mode? Cummins hints at new plan after MI lossSRH skipper Pat Cummins feels that his team does need to assess the conditions properly and find scores to target after their all-attack approach flopped once against during the humbling loss to Mumbai Indians on Wednesday, April 23.

Trent Boult relishing new role in MI after SRH win: Loving the blue and goldIPL 2025: Trent Boult's redefined bowling role at MI continues to pay off, with his four-wicket spell powering the side to a fourth straight win and pushing them into playoff contention in IPL 2025.

Rohit Sharma joins Virat Kohli on mount 12k, goes past Kieron Pollard in MI listRohit Sharma's fine knock of 70 against SRH helped him to reach the landmark of 12,000 runs in T20s, joining Virat Kohli in the process. Rohit also went past Kieron Pollard in an elite list for MI on Wednesday, April 23.

Pakistan's Nadeem snubs Neeraj Chopra Classic for Asian Athletics ChampionshipPakistan's javelin star and reigning Olympic champion Arshad Nadeem has decided to decline the invite to take part in the Neeraj Chopra classic event, which will take place in Bengaluru on May 24.

Rohit Sharma's slow IPL 2025 start was never a concern: Anil KumbleIPL 2025: Anil Kumble backed Rohit Sharma despite a slow IPL 2025 start, praising his composed approach and timely return to form, which coincided with Mumbai Indians' resurgence in the second half of the tournament.

Jasprit Bumrah equals Malinga's record for most wickets for MI in IPL historyIPL 2025: Jasprit Bumrah tied Lasith Malinga as MI's top wicket-taker in IPL history and became the fastest Indian to reach 300 T20 wickets, as MI bowlers restricted SRH despite Heinrich Klaasen's resistance.

Rajat Patidar enjoying learning process as RCB skipper: Input from seniors helping meRajat Patidar has said that he is enjoying the learning process as RCB skipper and said the input from the senior players is helping him a lot. Patidar has made a good start to life as the RCB skipper.

SRH, MI stars observe one-minute silence to honour Pahalgam attack victimsIPL 2025: Before the SRH vs MI match in Hyderabad, the IPL honoured victims of the Pahalgam terror attack with silence, black armbands, and no celebrations, as the nation mourned the tragic loss of 26 lives.

SRH vs MI: Shami on impact subs list for Hyderabad, Mumbai make one changeSRH decided to drop Mohammed Shami to the impact subs list for their must-win clash against MI in Hyderabad on Wednesday, April 23. Mumbai made one change to their team for the clash.

KL Rahul's flexibility gives Delhi Capitals depth in IPL 2025: Shane WatsonShane Watson feels that KL Rahul's flexibility has given DC depth with the bat this season in the IPL 2025. Rahul was the star of the show as DC defeated LSG for a second time this season.

Zimbabwe end 7-year wait for away Test win in BangladeshZimbabwe broke a seven-year overseas drought in style, toppling Bangladesh in a gripping Test finish. The win marked just their fourth away Test triumph, echoing their last victory at the same venue in 2018.

CSK never presses panic button: Chennai CEO Kasi Viswanathan on IPL 2025 runChennai Super Kings CEO Kasi Viswanathan has said that the franchise never presses the panic button despite their poor performances in the IPL 2025 season. CSK are currently in the final spot on the points table.

NBA: Jayson Tatum listed as doubtful for Game 2 vs Magic after wrist injuryThe Boston Celtics announced Tuesday, April 22, that All-Star forward Jayson Tatum is listed as doubtful for Game 2 of their first-round series against the Orlando Magic.

Virat Kohli and Sachin Tendulkar were among the several Indian sportspersons who condemned the terror attack.

Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma and other athletes condemn Pahalgam terror attackStar India cricketers Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma, among others, condemned the terrorist attack on tourists in Jammu & Kashmir's Pahalgam. 26 people lost their lives in the attack perpetrated by the members of The Resistance Front—an offshoot of the proscribed terror group Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT).

KL Rahul, Kevin Pietersen banter continues in hilarious dressing room momentIPL 2025: KL Rahul was in the mood to have fun during the dressing room celebrations after Delhi Capitals' win over Lucknow Super Giants on Tuesday. The Delhi star was involved in a hilarious moment with mentor Kevin Pietersen.

Pole vaulter Dev Meena breaks national record at Federation Cup 2025Pole vaulter Dev Meena broke the national record for a second time this season but fell short of the Asian Championships qualifying mark of 5.51m set by the Athletics Federation of India (AFI).

Rishabh Pant can't give any more excuses, needs to come up the order: Ambati RayuduFormer India cricketer turned commentator Ambati Rayudu has urged Rishabh Pant to come up the order and stop giving any excuses. Pant walked to bat at number seven against Delhi Capitals (DC) just for the second time in his IPL career.

Rishabh Pant under pressure: What's going wrong for LSG captain in IPL 2025?IPL 2025: Rishabh Pant has always thrived when high on confidence. But at LSG, he appears jaded and burdened. His body language tells the story — frustration, indecision, and hesitation. He's trying too hard and not backing his natural instincts.

'No cricket with Pakistan': Shreevats Goswami's plea to BCCI after Pahalgam attackFormer Indian cricketer Shreevats Goswami has urged the BCCI (Board of Control for Cricket in India) to bring an end to all cricketing relations with Pakistan in the aftermath of the Pahalgam terror attack.

Pant's frustration shows he was wronged by LSG management: Anil KumbleFormer India captain Anil Kumble questioned the decision to send Rishabh Pant to bat at No. 7, saying the LSG skipper's visible frustration showed he was wronged.

IPL 2025: Players to wear black armbands to pay homage to Pahalgam attack victimsThe BCCI (Board of Control for Cricket in India) will be paying tribute to the victims of the Pahalgam terror attack during Match 41 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) between Sunrisers Hyderabad and Mumbai Indians (MI).

Manchester City beat Villa: Guardiola calls season bad despite UCL hopes aliveManchester City secured a late winner against Aston Villa to boost their hopes of Champions League qualification next season, but Pep Guardiola admitted the team has had a 'bad' season.

Looking forward to having a positive 2nd half to our season: SRH assistant coachSunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) assistant coach Simon Helmot is hoping for their team to make a turnaround in the second half of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025). The Pat Cummins-led side is reeling at ninth spot with two wins from seven matches and will next take on Mumbai Indians in their home den.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
